Tried many and this was the winner.  Based on the size guide I would be a 13.5 US, mens but many of these Adidas don't offer but a 13 or 14.  I tried the Samba OG, Special, Stan Smith and finally the Gazelle.  Gotta say the Gazelle is the best fitting for my foot type.  It's definitely wider than the Spezial and Stan Smith which felt very narrow.  The Gazelle felt comfortable right out of the box and would definitely recommend.  Glad I finally found a pair that not only feel comfortable but look very stylish.

Ordered 2 pairs, got a notification arriving early. Sat at airport for 3 days, said delivered at 5 in the morning, but no evidence on cams that there was even an attempt. Now waiting with no evidence besides my screen captures that I've filled a complaint. They "may issue a refund". But I'm the meantime, I should just go buy the shoes at my local Adidas store. 
1) send me documentation
2) don't use your own questionable delivery service (really, 5 am at the beginning of a snow storm after sitting for 3 days with no update on texting)
3) if I had time to go to the store, I would have already gone! But, no time, not in stock in the size color I want. 

Take home, love the shoes, but buy through some one else or at a store. Do not buy through the online store. 

Now I've a 3 week trip starting without the shoes I ordered over 10 days ago that were supposed to be here 5 days ago. And when you have a broken for and 2 messed up knees over the course of the last year... It's not like just any shoes will do! 

Do better Adidas, do better.
